intro: Dicranopygium trianae, commonly known as the Andean fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Polypodiaceae. It is native to the Andes Mountains, where it thrives in cool, moist environments. The plant features a rhizomatous growth habit with fronds that are typically bipinnate, displaying a complex and delicate structure. Its spores are produced on the undersides of the fronds, and it reproduces through sexual reproduction. Dicranopygium trianae is often found in shaded, rocky habitats at high elevations.
